name: Chicken Chimichangas with Green Sauce
author: Bobbi W.
summary: These chimichangas save time by using leftover chicken, or a cold rotisserie chicken from the supermarket as well as canned items to make the sauce!
ingredients: 2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Pour the cream of chicken soup into a blender along with the green chiles, olives, jalapeno, and lime juice
Puree until smooth, then pour into a saucepan, and warm over medium-low heat while proceeding with the recipe
In a large bowl, stir together the cream cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and   until well blended
Evenly divide mixture among the 8 tortillas
Fold each tortilla into a rectangular packet around the filling
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Fry 4 chimichangas at a time until golden brown, then drain on a plate lined with paper towels
To serve, place a chimichanga on a plate, and ladle the warm sauce overtop
Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese and green onions
Finish with a dollop of sour cream
